channel.title: Homes on Nirbhay Modhe
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Nirbhay Modhe

item.description: Biography I am a PhD student advised by Prof. Dhruv Batra in the School of Interactive Computing within the College of Computing at Georgia Tech. I work on problems at the intersection of reinforcement learning (RL) and probabilistic modeling, applying the powerful inference techniques from the latter to solve challenging RL problems. I graduated from IIT Kanpur in 2017 with a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, where I worked with Prof.

item.title: News
item.description: [July, 2019]             Our recent work on unsupervised sub-goal discovery with intrinsic control is available on arXiv here. [2018 - 19] I served as a reviewer for CVPR19, ICLR19 and the TLLLEIB 2018. [June, 2018] Our PyTorch code for VisDial-RL is now live! [May, 2018] I will be interning at SRI International in the Center for Vision Technologies, working on stochastic video prediction for navigation.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching Assistant Georgia Tech, Fall 2019, CS4803 / CS7643: Deep Learning, by Prof. Dhruv Batra Georgia Tech, Fall 2018, CS4803 / CS7643: Deep Learning, by Prof. Dhruv Batra Tutor: Held weekly tutorial classes in addition to course instructor’s lectures: IIT Kanpur, Fall 2016, ESC101: Fundamentals of Computer Science, by Prof. Vinay Namboodiri Mentored a student for an Advanced Track project. IIT Kanpur, Spring 2017, ESC101: Fundamentals of Computer Science, by Prof.
